alert.note: Alert for Arco, Mud Lake Desert; Bear Lake Valley; Bear River Range; Big Hole Mountains; Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Centennial Mountains, Island Park; Eastern Magic Valley; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Lower Snake River Plain; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region; Shoshone, Lava Beds; Southern Hills, Albion Mountains; Teton Valley; Upper Snake River Plain (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 26 at 11:59AM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...AN AREA OF HEAVY SNOW WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF THE SNAKE PLAIN AND THE SOUTHERN AND EASTERN HIGHLANDS... At 1155 AM MST, the leading edge of an area of heavy snow was located along a line extending from the INL Complex to 6 miles southwest of Fort Hall Mount Putnam to near Juniper. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. Locations impacted include... Idaho Falls, Pocatello, Rexburg, Blackfoot, American Falls, Rigby, Soda Springs, Malad, McCammon, Lava Hot Springs, Swan Valley, Malta, Swanlake, Ririe, Neeley, Blackfoot Reservoir, Chesterfield, Goshen and Wayan. The snow can accumulate at a rate of one inch per hour or more in this area of heavy snow. Be prepared for hazardous driving conditions. Consider delaying travel if you will be going through this area of heavy snow. Visibilities are down to around one quarter mile at times, along with gusty winds in excess of 30 mph in this area of heavy snow. If you are driving, slow down and be on alert for other motorists. Low visibility shortens the amount of time you have to react to situations. A Winter Weather Advisory is in effect for the area. Please monitor local media outlets and the National Weather Service for further statements. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
